alert.note: Alert for Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 11:08AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Mainland Monroe and southern Miami-Dade Counties through NOON EDT... At 1108 AM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a funnel cloud along a line extending from 9 miles east of Flamingo to near East Cape Sable. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northwest Cape Sable, Everglades National Park, Flamingo, Middle Cape Sable, Mahogany Hammock and Pa-Hay-Okee Overlook. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Move indoors and stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until these storms pass. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.

area.areaDesc: Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Mainland Monroe
